title: Bug 102436 - Date/time value not stored correctly in report design
description: An invalid date/time string (which does not conform to a universal format or the system default locale format) should have been rejected.
OB: When a user creates a new 'DateTime' type report parameter in the BIRT report designer and provides an invalid date string, for example, '55/66/9999', the report designer does not reject the input.
EB: The report designer should reject the invalid date string and display an error message indicating that the date format is invalid.
SR:
1. Launch the BIRT report designer.
2. Create a new report parameter of type 'DateTime'.
3. In the 'default value' field, enter an invalid date string, such as '55/66/9999'.
4. Attempt to save the report design.
5. Verify that the report designer rejects the invalid date string and displays an error message.
